intro: Tetragonotheca abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian tetragonotheca, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, narrow leaves arranged in a tetragonal pattern. Its flowers are usually yellow or brown, and it produces small, dry fruits known as achenes. Tetragonotheca abyssinica is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
